001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.moments;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.List;
005
006import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
008
009/**
010 * This class defines static methods for moment calculations on 2D point sets.
011 * TODO: make more efficient versions!
012 * 
013 * @author WB
014 *
015 */
016public abstract class Moments2D {
017        
018        public static double ordinaryMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
019                double mpq = 0.0;
020                if (p == 0 && q == 0) { // just count the number of points
021                        for (@SuppressWarnings("unused") Pnt2d pnt : R) {
022                                mpq += 1;
023                        }
024                }
025                else {
026                        for (Pnt2d pnt : R) {
027                                mpq += Math.pow(pnt.getX(), p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY(), q);
028                        }
029                }
030                return mpq;
031        }
032
033        public static double centralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
034                double m00 = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 0); // region area
035                if (Arithmetic.isZero(m00)) {
036                        throw new RuntimeException("empty point set");
037                }
038                double xc = ordinaryMoment(R, 1, 0) / m00;
039                double yc = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 1) / m00;
040                double mupq = 0.0;
041                for (Pnt2d pnt : R) {
042                        mupq += Math.pow(pnt.getX() - xc, p) * Math.pow(pnt.getY() - yc, q);
043                }
044                return mupq;
045        }
046
047        public static double normalizedCentralMoment(Iterable<Pnt2d> R, int p, int q) {
048                double m00 = ordinaryMoment(R, 0, 0);
049                double scale = 1.0 / Math.pow(m00, 0.5 * (p + q) + 1);
050                return centralMoment(R, p, q) * scale;
051        }
052
053
054        public static void main(String[] args) {
055                
056                double s = 1.0;
057
058                List<Pnt2d> pts = new ArrayList<>();
059                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(10, 15));
060                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(3, 7));
061                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
062                pts.add(Pnt2d.from(-1, 5));
063                
064//              Pnt2d[] points = pts.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
065//              System.out.println("set size = " + points.length);
066                Iterable<Pnt2d> points = pts;
067
068                System.out.println("Ordinary moments:");
069                System.out.println("m00 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0));
070                System.out.println("m10 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0));
071                System.out.println("m01 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1));
072                System.out.println("m11 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 1));
073                System.out.println("m20 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 2, 0));
074                System.out.println("m02 = " + ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 2));
075
076                double a = ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 0);
077                System.out.println("a = " + a);
078                System.out.println("xc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 1, 0) / a));
079                System.out.println("yc = " + (ordinaryMoment(points, 0, 1) / a));       
080
081                System.out.println("Central moments:");
082                System.out.println("mu10 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 0));
083                System.out.println("mu01 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 1));
084                System.out.println("mu11 = " + centralMoment(points, 1, 1));
085                System.out.println("mu20 = " + centralMoment(points, 2, 0));
086                System.out.println("mu02 = " + centralMoment(points, 0, 2));
087                
088                System.out.println("Normalized central moments:");
089                System.out.println("nu10 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 1, 0));
090                System.out.println("nu01 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 0, 1));
091                System.out.println("nu11 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 1, 1));
092                System.out.println("nu20 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 2, 0));
093                System.out.println("nu02 = " + normalizedCentralMoment(points, 0, 2));
094        }
095
096}
097
098/*
099set size = 4
100m00 = 4.0
101m10 = 11.0
102m01 = 32.0
103a = 4.0
104xc = 2.75
105yc = 8.0
106mu10 = 0.0
107mu01 = 0.0
108mu11 = 73.0
109mu20 = 80.75
110mu02 = 68.0
111 */
